TopicTitle: Anyone Having Problems Flying Planes With The New Parts?

Articles.Content:
Still having issues with planes moving forward without holding E.

Edited October 9, 2014 by Googol

Have you tweaked the control surfaces to disable roll on the rudder and yaw on the ailerons? You can do that by right-clicking on them.

If you have, you'll want to post an example craft, and preferably a video showing the problem.

First thing I checked. All enabled.

Doing full reinstall now (steam shows 2.4 gigs going in, then downloads .9 gigs) starting to suspect Steam issue.

(steam shows 2.4 gigs going in, then downloads .9 gigs)

What the...? Silly old steam. XD That may be your issue.

Probably just compression or something. 2.5 gigs when finished... Thanks steam!

http://i.imgur.com/mo60mBz.jpg

My wheels seem to stick (checked brakes), unless I hold E, engines fire up, nothing happens.

No idea what the hell is going on.

I am an idiot.

I misread Master Tao's post. I am now disabling the proper things.

Thanks. And Sorry
